issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw:
To quote @knitfoo  from #207 -- this seems to be the same issue I'm seeing.  Reharnessing succeeds and detaches, but Valkyrie cannot walk again.
```
Essentially, if you fall down, the robot is unusable from that point forward; 
you have to restart the sim to regain use of the legs. You can reharness 
two, three, a zillion times, and the first step you attempt to take results in 
disaster. It's not clear exactly why; I have some sense that the robot may 
have lost it's sense of foot position (i.e. we command a baby step, and 
Val tries to take a huge step).
```
content.html:
To quote @knitfoo from #207 -- this seems to be the same issue I'm seeing. Reharnessing succeeds and detaches, but Valkyrie cannot walk again.

Essentially, if you fall down, the robot is unusable from that point forward; 
you have to restart the sim to regain use of the legs. You can reharness 
two, three, a zillion times, and the first step you attempt to take results in 
disaster. It's not clear exactly why; I have some sense that the robot may 
have lost it's sense of foot position (i.e. we command a baby step, and 
Val tries to take a huge step).

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall
Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: Not sure if this and #207 are same or different. Basically the re-harness is messy. I saw the pelvis issue also and mentioned it in $207. Got Val to work but took manually jiggling a bit. Even then she duck-walked to the finish box.
content.html: Not sure if this and #207 are same or different. Basically the re-harness is messy. I saw the pelvis issue also and mentioned it in $207. Got Val to work but took manually jiggling a bit. Even then she duck-walked to the finish box.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: @rmerriam The duck-walking you describe would be the same issue, where after reharnessing, Val's pelvis height in the world frame is different than it used to be.  I made this issue for those times when reharnessing succeeds and Valkyrie starts in a configuration such that she should be able to walk.  I've seen more extreme pelvis offsets, where Valkyrie is unable to take any steps at all.
content.html: @rmerriam The duck-walking you describe would be the same issue, where after reharnessing, Val's pelvis height in the world frame is different than it used to be. I made this issue for those times when reharnessing succeeds and Valkyrie starts in a configuration such that she should be able to walk. I've seen more extreme pelvis offsets, where Valkyrie is unable to take any steps at all.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: I've created pull request #99, which would reset the arm and leg joints after harnessing. I think it might help with this issue.
content.html: I've created pull request #99, which would reset the arm and leg joints after harnessing. I think it might help with this issue.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: Thanks @scpeters.  That'll help the tangling when lowering.  Not sure about the torso moving to match its old orientation in the world prior to a fall even after it gets teleported to a new location. I'm also still seeing this issue even when Val is reharnessed successfully.
content.html: Thanks @scpeters. That'll help the tangling when lowering. Not sure about the torso moving to match its old orientation in the world prior to a fall even after it gets teleported to a new location. I'm also still seeing this issue even when Val is reharnessed successfully.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: We're also seeing this behavior and noticed that we never see the harness detach.  It goes to lowering... switching to high level control and then just stays there.  So perhaps it constantly thinks it's in the harness and that's why it doesn't know its pelvis height?  Or perhaps this is a different issue with similar symptoms.
content.html: We're also seeing this behavior and noticed that we never see the harness detach. It goes to lowering... switching to high level control and then just stays there. So perhaps it constantly thinks it's in the harness and that's why it doesn't know its pelvis height? Or perhaps this is a different issue with similar symptoms.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: We had the same issue too. As per my observation, the z of world and pelvis is almost same when this occurs.
content.html: We had the same issue too. As per my observation, the z of world and pelvis is almost same when this occurs.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw:
I'm also seeing were messages are being ignored after a harness release. I have a set pattern of actions to reestablish the robot's stature. For example, one is spreading the feet apart. If I put two 'spreading' calls in a row the second one takes affect. It's happening nearly all the time with that action. Others are adjusting the pelvis height and the chest position. 

Also been doing a lot more running with all three tasks and it seems much worse with that setup.
content.html:
I'm also seeing were messages are being ignored after a harness release. I have a set pattern of actions to reestablish the robot's stature. For example, one is spreading the feet apart. If I put two 'spreading' calls in a row the second one takes affect. It's happening nearly all the time with that action. Others are adjusting the pelvis height and the chest position.

Also been doing a lot more running with all three tasks and it seems much worse with that setup.

issue.title: Valkyrie can't walk after reharnessing following a fall

content.raw: I'm also getting what seems like it might be the same issue even after being released from the *initial* harness, since updating srcsim to 0.7.0. The legs and feet appear in a crooked sort of position, and the transform to the world coordinate frame is unavailable.
content.html: I'm also getting what seems like it might be the same issue even after being released from the initial harness, since updating srcsim to 0.7.0. The legs and feet appear in a crooked sort of position, and the transform to the world coordinate frame is unavailable.
